meta.name: description
meta.content: Huntsville City Schools is dedicated to serving its students, their families and the greater Huntsville community.

ul.li: To provide rigorous, engaging instruction to all students that facilitates problem solving and creativity, aligned to grade-level standards using innovative resources and tools.
To provide holistic services that meet the academic, social, and emotional needs of our students.
To provide for and continuously empower all employees with modern strategies and skills that will, in turn, equip students for success

Ensure all Huntsville City Schools facilities are safe, while promoting conducive learning environments, maintaining appropriate financial reserves to cover all operating expenses, and setting a logistics framework for success.
Foster active and positive communication and engagement among students, staff, families, and the community in order to ensure that all stakeholders are engaged and well-informed partners.

div.p:
Senior Profile: Owen Stephens #16
HHS Memory: Win over Bob Jones during the 2020 regular season.
Advice: Enjoy it, because it can be over before you know it.
Future plans: Attend Birmingham-Southern on a Presidential Scholarship and continue academic and baseball career.

Dajonyna Mone' Wilson has participated in AFJROTC, the Robotics Team, and the Student Government Association (SGA) as a student at Mae C. Jemison High School. Her current plans are to go into Welding at Drake State for her major and minor in Art. After college she wants to find a welding job and sell her own art pieces for a hobby/side job. She would like to shout out her mother(s) for always giving her pep talks when she wanted to give up, her aunt and uncle for helping her settle on certain colleges and suggesting other majors, and her sisters for helping me at home with math. She would also like to thank her school family including Mr. Cole for opening her eyes and telling her she could do anything and not to listen to what anyone else says, Ms. Morris for sharing her passion for art with her, and Mrs. Batchelor and Ms. Weller for having the brightest personalities in the school and always making her smile when she felt bad. Lastly, she would just like to thank the faculty and staff for an amazing four years.

Huntsville City Schools (HCS) will open an additional meal service location at Morris School beginning Monday, April 20, 2020.
The Rock Church and Manna House will provide meals to youth 18 and under on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays from 10:30 a.m. until 12:30 p.m. Morris School is located at 4801 Bob Wallace Ave.
Other meal service locations are as follows: 1. Lee High School (2500 Meridian St. Huntsville, AL 35811) 2. Lakewood Elementary (3501 Kenwood Drive Huntsville, AL 35810) 3. McDonnell Elementary (4010 Binderton Place, Huntsville, AL 35805) 4. Ridgecrest Elementary (3505 Cerro Vista Dr. SW Huntsville, AL 35805) 5. Chaffee Elementary (7900 Whittier Road Huntsville, AL 35802) The new Morris site will mark the district's sixth meal service location in the community.
Thanks to WZYP for helping us spread the word about our Virtual Spirit Week for Seniors - begins tomorrow, April 20th!

p.strong: In accordance with the requirements of Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 ("ADA"), the Huntsville City Board of Education will not discriminate against qualified individuals with disabilities on the basis of disability in its services, programs, or activities. For more information please contact the compliance department.
